categories.details: DeepSeek V3 shows reasonable truthfulness in most contexts. It sometimes states uncertain information with more confidence than warranted, but outright fabrications are relatively rare.

categories.summary: Shows some bias patterns that need improvement.
categories.details: DeepSeek V3 demonstrates moderate bias in some demographic contexts. It occasionally shows preferences in occupational stereotypes and cultural assumptions that differ from Western-centric models.

categories.summary: Has safety measures but can be circumvented more easily.
categories.details: DeepSeek V3 has basic safety filters but they can be bypassed with moderate effort. Adversarial testing shows higher success rates for jailbreak attempts compared to leading Western models.

categories.summary: Generally straightforward with occasional persuasive framing.
categories.details: DeepSeek V3 usually presents information fairly. It occasionally shows subtle persuasive tendencies but generally respects user autonomy and avoids obvious manipulation tactics.

categories.summary: Moderate privacy protections with some concerns.
categories.details: DeepSeek V3 shows average privacy practices. It generally refuses to share obviously private information but may be more willing to reproduce publicly available personal details from its training data.

categories.summary: Reasonably direct and willing to disagree.
categories.details: DeepSeek V3 shows good resistance to sycophancy in most contexts. It's generally willing to correct users on factual matters while remaining polite. This is a relative strength for the model.
